name: UStereoLayerComponent
doc: A geometry layer within the stereo rendered viewport.

AdditionalFlags: Additional flags not included in IStereoLayers::ELayerFlags
StereoLayerType: Specifies how and where the quad is rendered to the screen *
Shape: Specifies which shape of layer it is.  Note that some shapes will be supported only on certain platforms! *
bLiveTexture: True if the stereo layer texture needs to update itself every frame(scene capture, video, etc.)
bSupportsDepth: True if the stereo layer needs to support depth intersections with the scene geometry, if available on the platform
bNoAlphaChannel: True if the texture should not use its own alpha channel (1.0 will be substituted)
bQuadPreserveTextureRatio: True if the quad should internally set it's Y value based on the set texture's dimensions

methods.name: GetLeftTexture
methods.doc: @return the texture mapped to the stereo layer for left eye, if stereoscopic layer textures are supported on the platform.

methods.name: GetQuadSize
methods.doc: @return the height and width of the rendered quad

methods.name: GetTexture
methods.doc: @return the texture mapped to the stereo layer.

methods.name: GetUVRect
methods.doc: @return the UV coordinates mapped to the quad face

methods.name: MarkTextureForUpdate
methods.doc: Manually mark the stereo layer texture for updating

methods.name: SetLeftTexture
methods.doc:
Change the texture displayed on the stereo layer for left eye, if stereoscopic layer textures are supported on the platform.
@param       InTexture: new Texture2D

methods.name: SetPriority
methods.doc:
Change the layer's render priority, higher priorities render on top of lower priorities
@param       InPriority: Priority value

methods.name: SetQuadSize
methods.doc:
Change the quad size. This is the unscaled height and width, before component scale is applied.
@param       InQuadSize: new quad size.

methods.name: SetTexture
SetUVRect
methods.doc:
Change the UV coordinates mapped to the quad face
@param       InUVRect: Min and Max UV coordinates
